title: Modeling financial uncertainty with multivariate temporal entropy-based curriculums
summary: This work proposes a novel multi-modal curriculum learning approach, FinCLASS, which evaluates stock affecting signals via entropy-based heuristics and measures their linguistic and price-based complexities in a time-aware, hierarchical fashion and shows how FinCLASS out-performs state-of-the-art across stock movement prediction, volatility regression, and proﬁt generation.
venue: Conference on Uncertainty in Artificial Intelligence
authors: Ramit Sawhney,Arnav Wadhwa,Ayush Mangal,V. Mittal,Shivam Agarwal,R. Shah

title: FAST: Financial News and Tweet Based Time Aware Network for Stock Trading
summary: This work proposes a novel hierarchical, learning to rank approach that uses textual data to make time-aware predictions for ranking stocks based on expected profit and outperforms state-of-the-art methods by over 8% in terms of cumulative profit and risk-adjusted returns.
venue: Conference of the European Chapter of the Association for Computational Linguistics

title: Fundamental Analysis based Neural Network for Stock Movement Prediction
summary: A fundamental analysis based neural network for stock movement prediction that introduces a coattention mechanism to capture the sufficient context information between text and prices across every day within a time window and obtains more sufficient stock representation.
venue: China National Conference on Chinese Computational Linguistics

title: Hybrid Information Mixing Module for Stock Movement Prediction
summary: A multilayer perceptron-based model, the hybrid information mixing module, is applied to the stock price movement prediction to conduct a price fluctuation prediction experiment in a stock market with high volatility.

title: Exploring the Scale-Free Nature of Stock Markets: Hyperbolic Graph Learning for Algorithmic Trading
summary: HyperStockGAT is proposed, the first model on the Riemannian Manifolds for stock selection and significantly outperforms state-of-the-art stock forecasting methods in terms of profitability by over 12%, and risk-adjusted Sharpe Ratio by over 4%.

title: A hybrid approach for stock trend prediction based on tweets embedding and historical prices
summary: A hybrid approach for stock market prediction based on tweets embedding and historical prices is proposed, which takes the internal semantic features and external structural characteristics of Twitter data into account, such that the generated tweet vectors can contain more effective information.

title: Quantitative Day Trading from Natural Language using Reinforcement Learning
summary: This work proposes a deep reinforcement learning approach that makes time-aware decisions to trade stocks while optimizing profit using textual data and outperforms state-of-the-art in terms of risk-adjusted returns in trading simulations on two benchmarks.
venue: North American Chapter of the Association for Computational Linguistics

title: Hyperbolic Online Time Stream Modeling
summary: This work proposes the first Hierarchical Time-Aware Hyperbolic LSTM, which leverages the Riemannian manifold for encoding the scale-free nature of a sequence of text in a time-aware fashion, and demonstrates HTLSTM's applicability for modeling temporal sequences of online information.
venue: Annual International ACM SIGIR Conference on Research and Development in Information Retrieval
authors: Ramit Sawhney,Shivam Agarwal,Megh Thakkar,Arnav Wadhwa,R. Shah

title: Graph-Based Learning for Stock Movement Prediction with Textual and Relational Data
summary: A new stock movement prediction framework is proposed: multigraph recurrent network for stock forecasting (MGRN), which allows combining the textual sentiment from financial news and multiple relational information extracted from other types of financial data.
venue: The Journal of Financial Data Science

title: Stock Movement Prediction Based on Bi-Typed Hybrid-Relational Market Knowledge Graph via Dual Attention Networks
summary: DANSMP, a novel Dual Attention Networks to learn the momentum spillover signals based upon the constructed MKG for stock prediction is proposed and demonstrated that the proposed DANSMP is capable of improving stock prediction with the constructedMKG.
venue: IEEE Transactions on Knowledge and Data Engineering
authors: Yu Zhao,Huaming Du,Ying Liu,Shaopeng Wei,Xingyan Chen,Fuzhen Zhuang,Qing Li,Ji Liu,Gang Kou

title: Quantitative Stock Investment by Routing Uncertainty-Aware Trading Experts: A Multi-Task Learning Approach
summary: AlphaMix is a novel two-stage mixture-of-experts (MoE) framework for quantitative investment to mimic the efficient bottom-up trading strategy design workflow of successful trading firms and is a universal framework that is applicable to various backbone network architectures with consistent performance gains.

title: Heterogeneous Interactive Snapshot Network for Review-Enhanced Stock Profiling and Recommendation
summary: This paper proposes a novel heterogeneous interactive snapshot network for stock profiling and recommendation, and introduces a novel twins-GRU method, which tightly couples the media and price parallel sequences in a cross-interactive fashion to catch dynamic dependencies between successive snapshots.
venue: International Joint Conference on Artificial Intelligence
authors: Heyuan Wang,Tengjiao Wang,Shun Li,Shijie Guan,Jiayi Zheng,Wei Chen

title: Stock Market Prediction via Deep Learning Techniques: A Survey
summary: This poster presents a probabilistic procedure to identify the neurons in the brain that secrete During the Yangtze River blackout, a process known as “red-plating”.
authors: Jinan Zou,Qi Zhao,Yang Jiao,Hai Cao,Yanxi Liu,Qingsen Yan,Ehsan Abbasnejad,Lingqiao Liu,Javen Qinfeng Shi

title: StockEmotions: Discover Investor Emotions for Financial Sentiment Analysis and Multivariate Time Series
summary: This paper introduces StockEmotions, a new dataset for detecting emotions in the stock market that consists of 10,000 English comments collected from StockTwits, a financial social media platform, Inspired by behavioral finance.
authors: Jean Lee,Hoyoul Luis Youn,Josiah Poon,S. Han

title: aiai at the NTCIR-14 FinNum Task : Financial Numeral Tweets Fine-Grained Classification Using Deep Word and Character Embedding-Based Attention Model
summary: The deep word and character embedding-based attention model is proposed to fine-grained classify the financial numeral tweets and has good performance.

title: Investigating the Impact of Public Mood in the Stock Market
summary: The overall purpose of this thesis is to study the correlation between scattered public mood and financial markets, and presents a solution to three classical problems of applied finance: the portfolio allocation problem, the formalization of market views and the use of mixed methods for stock returns prediction.
authors: Lorenzo Malandri,Frank Xing,C. Orsenigo,C. Vercellis,E. Cambria

title: Transformer-Based Capsule Network For Stock Movement Prediction
summary: A CapTE (Capsule network based on Transformer Encoder) model which uses the Trans transformer Encoder to extract the deep semantic features of the social media and then captures the structural relationship of the texts through a capsule network is proposed.
authors: Jintao Liu,Hongfei Lin,Xikai Liu,Bo Xu,Yuqi Ren,Yufeng Diao,Liang Yang

title: EMNLP-IJCNLP 2019 ECONLP — Economics and Natural Language Processing Proceedings of the Second Workshop on Economics and Natural Language Processing (ECONLP 2019)
Stock Trend Prediction using Financial Market News and BERT
summary: This paper applies the popular BERT model to leverage financial market news to predict stock price movements and shows that the proposed methods are simple but very effective, which can significantly improve the stock prediction accuracy on a standard financial database over the baseline system and existing work.
venue: International Conference on Knowledge Discovery and Information Retrieval

title: Machine Learning for Financial Risk Management: A Survey
summary: A taxonomy of financial-risk-management tasks and connect them with relevant machine learning methods is presented, and major challenges being faced by researchers in this area are identified.

title: FinTech Applications
venue: From Opinion Mining to Financial Argument Mining

title: Text-based Stock Market Analysis: A Review
summary: The aim of this study is to survey the main stock market analysis models, text representation techniques for financial market prediction, shortcomings of existing techniques, and propose promising directions for future research.

title: Improving the Prediction of Cryptocurrencies Movement Using Adversarial Training
Dynamic Graph Transformer for Implicit Tag Recognition
summary: This work presents a novel dynamic graph transformer that distills the textual information and the entity relations on the fly and confirms the effectiveness of the approach to implicit tag recognition.
venue: Conference of the European Chapter of the Association for Computational Linguistics

title: One Step Ahead: A Framework for Detecting Unexpected Incidents and Predicting the Stock Markets
summary: A framework that extracts incident facts globally based on a deep neural network, feeds them into models built on a global event database complemented with novel socioeconomic datasets, and predicts stock market directions in a simulated real-world setting with interpretable results that outperform various baselines is built.

title: Research on stock prediction algorithm based on CNN and LSTM
summary: The proposed model uses the convolution idea of CNN to construct feature extraction layer to extract features, and inputs the extracted features into LSTM, to study the temporal message of the features better and is effective in reducing forecasting errors.
venue: Academic Journal of Computing & Information Science

title: GCNET: A novel graph-based approach for prediction of stock price movement
summary: GCNET is a general prediction framework that can be applied for the prediction of the price ﬂuctuations of interacting stocks based on their historical data and uses a set of history-based prediction models to infer plausible initial labels for a subset of the stock nodes in the graph.

title: DeepScalper: A Risk-Aware Deep Reinforcement Learning Framework for Intraday Trading with Micro-level Market Embedding
summary: DeepScalper is proposed, a deep reinforcement learning framework for intraday trading that adopts an encoder-decoder architecture to learn robust market embedding incorporating both macro-level and micro-level market information and proposes a risk-aware auxiliary task by predicting future volatility.
authors: Shuo Sun,Rundong Wang,Xu He,Junlei Zhu,Jian Li,Bo An

title: HYPHEN: Hyperbolic Hawkes Attention For Text Streams
summary: A Hyperbolic Hawkes Attention Network (HYPHEN), which learns a data-driven hyperbolic space and models irregular powerlaw excitations using a hyperbolics Hawkes process, and its practical applicability for modeling online text sequences in a geometry agnostic manner is demonstrated.
venue: Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics
authors: Shivam Agarwal,Ramit Sawhney,S. Ahuja,R. Soun,S. Chava

title: Causality-Guided Multi-Memory Interaction Network for Multivariate Stock Price Movement Prediction
summary: The proposed Causality-guided Multi-memory Interaction Network (CMIN), a novel end-to-end deep neural network for stock movement prediction which, for the first time, models the multi-modality between financial text data and causality-enhanced stock correlations to achieve higher prediction accuracy.
venue: Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics
authors: Di Luo,Weiheng Liao,Shuqi Li,Xin Cheng,Rui Yan

title: Predicting short-term Bitcoin price fluctuations from buy and sell orders
summary: A generative temporal mixture model of the volatility and trade order book data is constructed, which is able to out-perform the current state-of-the-art machine learning and time-series statistical models.

title: Bitcoin Volatility Forecasting with a Glimpse into Buy and Sell Orders
summary: This paper proposes temporal mixture models capable of adaptively exploiting both volatility history and order book features, and demonstrates the prospect of the temporal mixture model as an interpretable forecasting framework over heterogeneous Bitcoin data.

title: Enhancing Stock Movement Prediction with Adversarial Training
summary: A new machine learning solution for stock movement prediction, which aims to predict whether the price of a stock will be up or down in the near future, is added to simulate the stochasticity of price variable, and train the model to work well under small yet intentional perturbations.
venue: International Joint Conference on Artificial Intelligence
authors: Fuli Feng,Huimin Chen,Xiangnan He,Ji Ding,Maosong Sun,Tat-Seng Chua

title: Ensemble of Technical Analysis and Machine Learning for Market Trend Prediction
summary: A new approach that leverages technical analysis to predict market directional movements is proposed, which aims to predict the directional movement of the NASDAQ’s most capitalized stocks by solving a classification problem.
venue: IEEE Symposium Series on Computational Intelligence
authors: Andrea Picasso Ratto,Simone Merello,L. Oneto,Yukun Ma,Lorenzo Malandri,E. Cambria

title: Investigating Timing and Impact of News on the Stock Market
summary: Results on US market show that the information contained in news can be used as an accurate predictor for past price movements, when the future is considered, however, the correlation between news and stock market becomes less clear.
venue: 2018 IEEE International Conference on Data Mining Workshops (ICDMW)
authors: Simone Merello,Andrea Picasso Ratto,Yukun Ma,L. Oneto,E. Cambria

title: Knowledge-Driven Stock Trend Prediction and Explanation via Temporal Convolutional Network
summary: A novel Knowledge-Driven Temporal Convolutional Network is proposed for stock trend prediction and explanation that can react to abrupt changes much faster and outperform state-of-the-art methods on stock datasets, as well as facilitate the explanation of prediction particularly with abrupt changes.
authors: Shumin Deng,Ningyu Zhang,Wen Zhang,Jiaoyan Chen,Jeff Z. Pan,Huajun Chen

title: Ensemble Application of Transfer Learning and Sample Weighting for Stock Market Prediction
summary: Results on a real simulation of trading show how the problem of stock market forecasting is formulated as regression of market returns can be used to invest in high performing stocks and achieve higher profits with less trades.
venue: IEEE International Joint Conference on Neural Network
authors: Simone Merello,Andrea Picasso Ratto,L. Oneto,E. Cambria

title: AlphaStock: A Buying-Winners-and-Selling-Losers Investment Strategy using Interpretable Deep Reinforcement Attention Networks
summary: It turns out that AlphaStock tends to select the stocks as winners with high long-term growth, low volatility, high intrinsic value, and being undervalued recently.
authors: Jingyuan Wang,Yang Zhang,Ke Tang,Junjie Wu,Zhang Xiong

title: Group, Extract and Aggregate: Summarizing a Large Amount of Finance News for Forex Movement Prediction
summary: This work proposes a BERT-based Hierarchical Aggregation Model to summarize a large amount of finance news to predict forex movement and shows that the category based method performs best among three grouping methods and outperforms all the baselines.
venue: Conference on Empirical Methods in Natural Language Processing
authors: Deli Chen,Shuming Ma,Keiko Harimoto,Ruihan Bao,Qi Su,Xu Sun

title: Incorporating Fine-grained Events in Stock Movement Prediction
summary: This work proposes a professional finance event dictionary built by domain experts and uses it to extract fine-grained events automatically from finance news, and designs a neural model to combine finance news with fine- grained event structure and stock trade data to predict the stock movement.
venue: Conference on Empirical Methods in Natural Language Processing
authors: Deli Chen,Yanyan Zou,Keiko Harimoto,Ruihan Bao,Xuancheng Ren,Xu Sun

title: A Divide-and-Conquer Framework for Attention-based Combination of Multiple Investment Strategies
summary: A 2D-attention framework to capture the dynamics of the above two factors, which categorizes the whole market periods into a few stable states and jointly learn respective models for each state and build a state-wise attention model to combine them dynamically for the final task.
venue: IEEE Global Conference on Signal and Information Processing
authors: Xiao Yang,Weiqing Liu,Lewen Wang,Cheng Qu,Jiang Bian

title: Learning to Fuse Multiple Semantic Aspects from Rich Texts for Stock Price Prediction
summary: Experimental results on real data sets show the superior performance of MAFN against several strong baselines as well as the effectiveness of exploiting and fusing fine-grained aspect-level textual information for stock price prediction.

title: Technical analysis and sentiment embeddings for market trend prediction
summary: This work aims to combine both technical and fundamental analysis through the application of data science and machine learning techniques and produces a robust predictive model able to forecast the trend of a portfolio composed by the twenty most capitalized companies listed in the NASDAQ100 index.
authors: Andrea Picasso Ratto,Simone Merello,Yukun Ma,L. Oneto,E. Cambria

title: Applications of deep learning in stock market prediction: recent progress
summary: A review of recent works on deep learning models for stock market prediction by category the different data sources, various neural network structures, and common used evaluation metrics to help the interested researchers to synchronize with the latest progress and also help them to easily reproduce the previous studies as baselines.

title: NLP in FinTech Applications: Past, Present and Future
summary: This position paper focuses on the researches applying natural language processing (NLP) technologies in the finance domain and outlines the application scenarios from three aspects including Know Your Customer (KYC), Know Your Product (KYP), and Satisfy Your customer (SYC).

title: Fine-grained Financial Opinion Mining: A Survey and Research Agenda
summary: A road map of fine-grained financial opinion mining is proposed for future researches, and several challenges yet to explore are pointed out.

title: Multi-Graph Convolutional Network for Relationship-Driven Stock Movement Prediction
summary: A deep learning framework, called Multi-GCGRU, which comprises graph convolutional network (GCN) and gated recurrent unit (GRU) to predict stock movement, which is feasible to incorporate more effective stock relationships containing expert knowledge, as well as learn data-driven relationship.

title: ND-SMPF: A Noisy Deep Neural Network Fusion Framework for Stock Price Movement Prediction
summary: The proposed ND-SMPF predictive framework uses information fusion to combine twitter data with extended horizon market historical prices to boost the accuracy of the stock movement prediction task.

title: Modeling the Stock Relation with Graph Network for Overnight Stock Movement Prediction
summary: A LSTM Relational Graph Convolutional Network model, which models the connection among stocks with their correlation matrix, which outperforms the baseline models and enables the movement of stocks that are not directly associated with news as well as the whole market, which is not available in most previous methods.
venue: International Joint Conference on Artificial Intelligence
authors: Wei Li,Ruihan Bao,Keiko Harimoto,Deli Chen,Jingjing Xu,Qi Su

title: Stock Embeddings Acquired from News Articles and Price History, and an Application to Portfolio Optimization
summary: The results of portfolio optimization using Reuters & Bloomberg headlines, producing a capital gain 2.8 times larger than that obtained with a baseline method using only stock price data suggests that the proposed stock embedding can leverage textual financial semantics to solve financial prediction problems.
venue: Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics

title: Stock Index Prediction with Multi-task Learning and Word Polarity Over Time
summary: A two-stage system that consists of a sentiment extractor to extract the opinion on the market trend and a summarizer that predicts the direction of the index movement of following week given the opinions of the news over the current week is proposed.

title: Towards Earnings Call and Stock Price Movement
summary: This work proposes to model the language in transcripts using a deep learning framework, where an attention mechanism is applied to encode the text data into vectors for the discriminative network classifier to predict stock price movements.

title: Multimodal Multi-Task Financial Risk Forecasting
summary: This work presents a multi-task solution that utilizes domain specialized textual features and audio attentive alignment for predictive financial risk and price modeling and shows the effectiveness of the deep multimodal approach.
authors: Ramit Sawhney,Puneet Mathur,Ayush Mangal,Piyush Khanna,R. Shah,Roger Zimmermann

title: Connecting the dots: forecasting and explaining short-term market volatility
summary: This work proposes news-powered neural models to forecast short-term volatility and presents a soft-constrained dynamic beam allocation algorithm to control the state-of-the-art language model (GPT-2) to generate fluent and informative explanations.
venue: International Conference on AI in Finance

title: Utilization of deep learning to mine insights from earning calls for stock price movement predictions
summary: This work uses earning call transcripts combined with companies' historical stock data and sector information to predict company's stock price movements and proposes a deep learning framework jointly, where attention mechanism is applied to the earnings call textual feature and a recurrent neural network is used on the sequential stock price data.
venue: International Conference on AI in Finance

title: Market volatility prediction based on long- and short-term memory retrieval architectures
summary: A new deep neural network-based architecture named Long- and Short-term Memory Retrieval (LSMR) architecture to forecast short-term and mid-term volatility and demonstrates the superior performance of the proposed models in predicting highly volatile scenarios, compared to existing methods in the literature.
venue: International Conference on AI in Finance

title: Spatiotemporal Hypergraph Convolution Network for Stock Movement Forecasting
summary: STHGCN significantly outperforms state-of-the-art stock forecasting methods over extensive experiments on long term realworld S&P500 index data of stocks traded in the NASDAQ and NYSE markets over 12 diverse phases and proposes a novel architecture for stock trend forecasting that can be applied across various problems in the spatiotemporal domain.

title: Enhancing Stock Trend Prediction Models by Mining Relational Graphs of Stock Prices
summary: The proposed RGStocknet (Relational Graph Stock Enhancing Network) framework is proposed that can boost performance on an arbitrary time series prediction backbone model and carry the potential to incorporate relations with external resources to achieve higher performance further.
venue: 2020 International Conference on Pervasive Artificial Intelligence (ICPAI)

title: Stock Movement Classification from Twitter via Mogrifier Based Memory Cells with Attention Mechanism
summary: Experiment on real-world stock market data shows the Mogrifier based cell can outperform the venerable ones across different market sectors while still achieves lower prediction volatility.
venue: International Conferences on Information Technologies and Electrical Engineering

title: ADD: Augmented Disentanglement Distillation Framework for Improving Stock Trend Forecasting
summary: This paper introduces an augmented Disentanglement Distillation approach to remove interferential features from the noised raw data to avoid the two factors disturbing each other's own prediction.

title: COVID19-HPSMP: COVID-19 adopted Hybrid and Parallel deep information fusion framework for stock price movement prediction
summary: A novel hybrid and parallel DNN-based framework is proposed that integrates different and diversified learning architectures and innovative fusion strategies are used to combine scattered social media news related to COVID-19 with historical mark data.

title: REST: Relational Event-driven Stock Trend Forecasting
summary: This paper proposes a relational event-driven stock trend forecasting (REST) framework, which can address the shortcoming of existing methods and construct a stock graph and design a new propagation layer to propagate the effect of event information from related stocks.
authors: W. Xu,Weiqing Liu,Chang Xu,Jiang Bian,Jian Yin,Tie-Yan Liu

title: FinSense: An Assistant System for Financial Journalists and Investors
summary: Given the draft of a financial news story, FinSense extracts the explicit-mentioned stocks and further infers the implicit stocks, providing insightful information for decision making and proposes a novel graph convolutional network model that performs implicit financial instrument inference toward the in-domain data.
authors: Yi-Ting Liou,Chung-Chi Chen,Tsun-Hsien Tang,Hen-Hsen Huang,Hsin-Hsi Chen

title: Recurrent dictionary learning for state-space models with an application in stock forecasting
summary: Experimental results show that the proposed RDL method excels over state-of-the-art stock analysis models such as CNN-TA, MFNN, and LSTM and is particularly well suited for stock forecasting.

title: A New Strategy for Short-Term Stock Investment Using Bayesian Approach
summary: This paper transforms the daily stock price time series object into a data frame format where the dependent variable is the stock trend label and the independent variables are the stock variations of the last few days and proposes a new method for stock selection and a new stock trading strategy.

title: A New Strategy for Short-Term Stock Investment Using Bayesian Approach
summary: This paper transforms the daily stock price time series object into a data frame format where the dependent variable is the stock trend label and the independent variables are the stock variations of the last few days and proposes a new method for stock selection and a new stock trading strategy.

title: Risk-aware Regularization for Opinion-based Portfolio Selection
venue: International Conference on Web and Social Media

title: Learning Multiple Stock Trading Patterns with Temporal Routing Adaptor and Optimal Transport
summary: A novel architecture, Temporal Routing Adaptor (TRA), is proposed to empower existing stock prediction models with the ability to model multiple stock trading patterns and design a learning algorithm based on Optimal Transport to obtain the optimal sample to predictor assignment and effectively optimize the router with such assignment through an auxiliary loss term.

title: Retrieving Implicit Information for Stock Movement Prediction
summary: A neural network framework that jointly learns with a news selection mechanism to extract implicit information from the chaotic daily news pool and takes advantage of neural representation learning and collaborative filtering to capture the relationship between stocks and news is developed.
venue: Annual International ACM SIGIR Conference on Research and Development in Information Retrieval

title: Stock Movement Prediction with Financial News using Contextualized Embedding from BERT
summary: This paper introduces a new text mining method called Fine-Tuned Contextualized-Embedding Recurrent Neural Network (FT-CE-RNN), which uses contextualized vector representations of the headlines (contextualized embeddings) generated from Bidirectional Encoder Representations from Transformers (BERT).

title: Quantifying the effects of long-term news on stock markets on the basis of the multikernel Hawkes process
summary: A novel multikernel-powered Hawkes process framework is proposed, which uses multiple kernels to model different time-decaying rates, thus alleviating the instability of the proposed Hawke process based prediction model.
authors: Xiao Ding,Jihao Shi,Junwen Duan,Bing Qin,Ting Liu

title: Accurate Multivariate Stock Movement Prediction via Data-Axis Transformer with Multi-Level Contexts
summary: This work proposes DTML (Data-axis Transformer with Multi-Level contexts), a novel approach for stock movement prediction that learns the correlations between stocks in an end-to-end way and achieves the state-of-the-art accuracy on six datasets collected from various stock markets from US, China, Japan, and UK.

title: Reinforcement Learning for Quantitative Trading
summary: A taxonomy of RL-based QT models is devised, along with a comprehensive summary of the state of the art, and current challenges and proposed future research directions in this exciting field are discussed.
venue: ACM Transactions on Intelligent Systems and Technology

title: SENTiVENT: enabling supervised information extraction of company-specific events in economic and financial news
summary: This work fills a large need for a manually annotated dataset for economic and financial text mining applications and produces a gold-standard dataset annotated with event triggers, participant arguments, event co-reference, and event attributes such as type, subtype, negation, and modality.

title: HIST: A Graph-based Framework for Stock Trend Forecasting via Mining Concept-Oriented Shared Information
summary: A novel stock trend forecasting framework that can adequately mine the concept-oriented shared information from predefined concepts and hidden concepts is proposed that can achieve a higher investment return than the baselines.
authors: Wentao Xu,Weiqing Liu,Lewen Wang,Yingce Xia,Jiang Bian,Jian Yin,Tie-Yan Liu

title: A review of natural language processing for financial technology
summary: This review first introduces the development of natural language processing, and then summarizes their applications in financial technology, which mainly focuses on public opinion analysis, financial prediction and analysis, risk assessment, intelligent question answering, and automatic document generation.
authors: Ruizhuo Gao,Zeqi Zhang,Zhenning Shi,Dan Xu,Weijuan Zhang,Dewei Zhu

title: Time horizon-aware modeling of financial texts for stock price prediction
venue: International Conference on AI in Finance
authors: Fuli Feng,Xiang Wang,Xiangnan He,Ritchie Ng,Tat-Seng Chua

title: DeepScalper: A Risk-Aware Reinforcement Learning Framework to Capture Fleeting Intraday Trading Opportunities
summary: DeepScalper is proposed, a deep reinforcement learning framework for intraday trading that significantly outperforms many state-of-the-art baselines in terms of four financial criteria.
venue: International Conference on Information and Knowledge Management
authors: Shuo Sun,Xu He,R. Wang,Junlei Zhu,Jian Li,Bo An

title: Stock movement prediction via gated recurrent unit network based on reinforcement learning with incorporated attention mechanisms
NumHTML: Numeric-Oriented Hierarchical Transformer Model for Multi-task Financial Forecasting
summary: A numeric-oriented hierarchical transformer model (NumHTML) to predict stock returns, and financial risk using multi-modal aligned earnings calls data by taking advantage of the different categories of numbers and their magnitude.
authors: Linyi Yang,Jiazheng Li,Ruihai Dong,Yue Zhang,B. Smyth

title: An Exploratory Study of Stock Price Movements from Earnings Calls
GCNET: graph-based prediction of stock price movement using graph convolutional network
summary: A novel framework, called GCNET, is introduced that models the relations among an arbitrary set of stocks as a graph structure called influence network and uses a set of history-based prediction models to infer plausible initial labels for a subset of the stock nodes in the graph.

title: Twitter-aided decision making: a review of recent developments
summary: This review examines 28 newer papers published in last five years that continued to advance Twitter-aided decision making, and offers a methodological analysis that considers four aspects of methods used in these papers, including problem formulation, solution, Twitter feature, and information transformation.
authors: Yihong Zhang,Masumi Shirakawa,Yuanyuan Wang,Zhi Li,Takahiro Hara

title: Incorporating Transformers and Attention Networks for Stock Movement Prediction
summary: A transformer-based attention network framework that uses historical text and stock prices to capture the temporal dependence of financial data to achieve an accurate prediction of stock movements is proposed.

title: Inductive Representation Learning on Dynamic Stock Co-Movement Graphs for Stock Predictions
authors: Hu Tian,Xiaolong Zheng,Kang Zhao,Maggie Wenjing Liu,D. Zeng

title: Stock portfolio selection balancing variance and tail risk via stock vector representation acquired from price data and texts
Transformer-based attention network for stock movement prediction
authors: Qiuyue Zhang,Chao Qin,Yunfeng Zhang,Fangxun Bao,Caiming Zhang,Peide Liu

title: A self-regulated generative adversarial network for stock price movement prediction based on the historical price and tweets
Read the News, Not the Books: Forecasting Firms’ Long-term Financial Performance via Deep Text Mining
summary: Textual data from firm-related events in news articles can effectively predict various firm financial ratios, with or without historical financial ratio, and news-powered deep learning models are shown to outperform standard econometric models operating on precise accounting historical data.
venue: ACM Transactions on Management Information Systems

title: Astock: A New Dataset and Automated Stock Trading based on Stock-specific News Analyzing Model
summary: A platform to study the NLP-aided stock auto-trading algorithms systematically and proposes a self-supervised learning strategy based on SRLP to enhance the out-of-distribution generalization performance of the system.
authors: Jinan Zou,Hai Cao,Lingqiao Liu,Yuhao Lin,Ehsan Abbasnejad,Javen Qinfeng Shi

title: FactorVAE: A Probabilistic Dynamic Factor Model Based on Variational Autoencoder for Predicting Cross-Sectional Stock Returns
summary: This paper proposes a novel factor model, FactorVAE, as a probabilistic model with inherent randomness for noise modeling, and proposes a prior-posterior learning method based on VAE, which can effectively guide the learning of model by approximating an optimal posterior factor model with future information.

title: Instance-based deep transfer learning with attention for stock movement prediction
summary: Experimental results reveal that the proposed novel instance-based deep transfer learning models with attention mechanism significantly improve the performance of deep learning models when limited training data are available.
authors: Qi-Qiao He,S. W. I. Siu,Yain-Whar Si

title: Evaluating Impact of Social Media Posts by Executives on Stock Prices
summary: This paper investigates the impact of social media posts on close price prediction of stocks using Twitter and Reddit posts and shows improvements in prediction on including social media data and greater improvements on including executive posts.

title: FinTech for Social Good: A Research Agenda from NLP Perspective
Accurate Stock Movement Prediction with Self-supervised Learning from Sparse Noisy Tweets
summary: SLOT (Self-supervised Learning of Tweets for Capturing Multi-level Price Trends), an accurate method for stock movement prediction, which learns multi-level relationships between stocks from tweets, making it robust to the unreliability of tweets.
venue: 2022 IEEE International Conference on Big Data (Big Data)
authors: Yejun Soun,Jaemin Yoo,Minyong Cho,Jihyeong Jeon,U. Kang

title: Improved Stock Price Movement Classification Using News Articles Based on Embeddings and Label Smoothing
summary: This paper proposes to improve stock price movement prediction using news articles by incorporating regularization and optimization techniques from deep learning, and incorporates weight decay, batch normalization, dropout, and label smoothing to improve the generalization of the trained models.
authors: Luis Villamil,Ryan Bausback,Shaeke Salman,Ting Liu,Conrad Horn,Xiuwen Liu

title: Model-Agnostic Meta-Learning for Natural Language Understanding Tasks in Finance
summary: The authors' models achieve the state-of-the-art performance according to the experimental results, which demonstrate that the MAML method can adapt fast and well to low-resource situations.

title: Logit-based stock prediction network
summary: A logit-based stock prediction network LogNet is proposed, which uses the correctly predicted logits to measure the reliability of stock data, then calculate the confidence interval of the stockData, and use the credible data to make stock predictions.
venue: Fifth International Conference on Computer Information Science and Artificial Intelligence

title: Multi-stage Hybrid Attentive Networks for Knowledge-Driven Stock Movement Prediction
venue: International Conference on Neural Information Processing

title: Multimodal Multi-Speaker Merger & Acquisition Financial Modeling: A New Task, Dataset, and Neural Baselines
summary: M3ANet is introduced, a baseline architecture that takes advantage of the multimodal multi-speaker input to forecast the financial risk associated with the M&A calls and is released to motivate future research on this challenging problem domain.
venue: Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics
authors: Ramit Sawhney,Mihir Goyal,Prakhar Goel,Puneet Mathur,R. Shah

title: Incorporating Stock Market Signals for Twitter Stance Detection
summary: A robust multi-task neural architecture that combines textual input with high-frequency intra-day time series from stock market prices is proposed, demonstrating that the combination of multiple input signals is effective for cross-target stance detection, and opens interesting research directions for future work.
venue: Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics
authors: Costanza Conforti,Jakob Berndt,Mohammad Taher Pilehvar,Chryssi Giannitsarou,Flavio Toxvaerd,Nigel Collier

title: Meta-Adaptive Stock Movement Prediction with Two-Stage Representation Learning
summary: Inspired by importance sampling probability for tasks to balance the domain dis- crepancy caused by evolving temporal domains, a novel framework for stock movement pre-7 diction based on self-supervised learning and meta-learning is presented.

title: Sentiment Analysis of Stocktwits Data With Word Vector and Gated Recurrent Unit
summary: This study proposes to use Gated Recurrent Unit (GRU) for predicting the sentiment of tweets related to stockprice, and implements word vector, in particular word2vec, as features for GRU.

title: Selective transfer learning with adversarial training for stock movement prediction
summary: The STLAT method advances existing solutions in two major aspects: (i) tailoring the pre-trained and fine-tuned method for stock movement prediction and (ii) introducing the data selector module to select the more relevant training samples from stocks in source domain.

title: A Word is Worth A Thousand Dollars: Adversarial Attack on Tweets Fools Stock Prediction
summary: This paper addresses the task of adversarial generation by solving combinatorial optimization problems with semantics and budget constraints with consistent success rates and cause significant monetary loss in trading simulation by simply concatenating a perturbed but semantically similar tweet.
venue: North American Chapter of the Association for Computational Linguistics
authors: Yong Xie,Dakuo Wang,Pin-Yu Chen,Jinjun Xiong,Sijia Liu,O. Koyejo

title: Forecasting COVID-19 Caseloads Using Unsupervised Embedding Clusters of Social Media Posts
summary: A novel approach incorporating transformer-based language models into infectious disease modelling by tracking high-density clusters of sentence-level representations of Reddit posts within specific US states’ COVID-19 subreddits shows that these clustered embedding features outperform all other feature types at predicting upward trend signals.
venue: North American Chapter of the Association for Computational Linguistics

title: MetaTrader: An Reinforcement Learning Approach Integrating Diverse Policies for Portfolio Optimization
summary: MetaTrader is proposed, a novel two-stage RL-based approach for portfolio management, which learns to integrate diverse trading policies to adapt to various market conditions and significantly outperforms state-of-the-art baselines in balancing profits and risks.
venue: International Conference on Information and Knowledge Management

title: Multimodal Neural Network For Demand Forecasting
summary: A multi-modal sales forecasting network that combines real-life events from news articles with traditional data such as historical sales and holiday information is proposed that fuse information from general product trends published by Google trends.
venue: International Conference on Neural Information Processing

title: Stock Movement Prediction via Temporal Convolutional Network and Interactive Attention Network
summary: A novel method to predict the stock movement based on Temporal Convolution Network (TCN) and Interactive Attention Network (IAN), in which TCN can effectively avoid using future information when obtaining the features of text and price.
venue: 2023 International Conference on Intelligent and Innovative Technologies in Computing, Electrical and Electronics (IITCEE)

title: Spatiotemporal Transformer for Stock Movement Prediction
Cryptoblend: An AI-Powered Tool for Aggregation and Summarization of Cryptocurrency News
summary: Cutting-edge solutions in the field of natural language processing were employed to cluster news by topic and summarize the corresponding articles published by different newspapers, and the results show the effectiveness of the proposed methodology in most of the cases.

title: What Do We Know About Meme Stocks? A Bibliometric and Systematic Review, Current Streams, Developments, and Directions for Future Research
Mutual coupling between stock market and cryptocurrencies
Predicting Stock Price Movement Direction with Enterprise Knowledge Graph
summary: This research proposes power vector model and influence propagation model to mine the rich information in constructed Enterprise Knowledge Graph (EKG) for price movement prediction and shows good prediction performance on the dataset of China top 500 enterprises.
venue: Pacific Asia Conference on Information Systems

title: Ju n 20 18 Multivariable LSTM neural network for autoregressive exogenous model
summary: This paper proposes a multi-variable LSTM capable of accurate forecasting and variable importance interpretation for time series with exogenous variables and exhibits the prospect of multi- variable L STM as an end-to-end framework for both forecasting and knowledge discovery.

title: Stock market trend prediction with sentiment analysis based on LSTM neural network
summary: This thesis aims to propose a method of feature selection for selecting useful stock indexes and proposes deep learning model to do sentiment analysis of financial news as another influencing factor influencing stock trend.

title: Machine Learning Techniques for Annotations of Large Financial Text Datasets
summary: This work seeks to investigate the use of machine learning techniques for annotations on UIMA a framework used for the analysis of unstructured data.

title: News-oriented Stock Price Trend Prediction
summary: With the analysis of daily news’ impact on stock markets, some key features that could be useful in stock price prediction are identified and a deep learning model is proposed to capture the dynamics of stock price trend with rich news textual information.

title: Augmented Textual Features-Based Stock Market Prediction
summary: A comparison of the approach with other sentiment-based stock market prediction approaches including Deep learning, establishes that the proposed model is performing adequately and predicting stock movements with a higher accuracy than other approaches.

title: Combining Hybrid Attention Networks and LSTM for Stock Trend Prediction
summary: This research merge two different models of the Hybrid Attention Networks and the Long Short-Term Memory to improve the stock trend prediction and shows that the best accuracy score, combined with news and stock prices, is 80 %.
venue: Taiwan Conference on Computational Linguistics and Speech Processing

title: AR-Stock: Deep Augmented Relational Stock Prediction
summary: A novel framework of Deep Augmented Relational Stock Prediction ( AR-Stock), that predicts each company’s stock prices by leveraging its related corporations and introduces two novel self-supervised regularizers to inform the model with the global and local topol- ogy features.

title: ALGA: Automatic Logic Gate Annotator for Building Financial News Events Detectors
summary: It is shown that event detection classiﬁers trained on the data generated by the ALGA framework can achieve state-of-the-art performance in the domain-speciﬂc ﬁnancial events detection task.
venue: Hawaii International Conference on System Sciences

title: HIVE: Hierarchical Information Visualization for Explainability
summary: An interactive tool is developed to demonstrate the ability and versatility of an explainable risk ranking model with a special focus on financial use cases and can benefit both academics and practitioners in finance as they can work around deep learning models with their newly gained insights.
venue: International Joint Conference on Artificial Intelligence
authors: Yi Juan,Yi-Shyuan Chiang,Shang-Chuan Liu,Ming-Feng Tsai,Chuan-Ju Wang

title: XRR: Explainable Risk Ranking for Financial Reports
summary: The proposed eXplainable Risk Ranking model uses multilevel encoders and attention mechanisms to analyze financial risks among companies and enables to highlight the critical words and sentences within financial reports that are most likely to influence financial risk and thus boasts better model explainability.
authors: Ting-Wei Lin,Ruei-Yao Sun,Hsuan-Ling Chang,Chuan-Ju Wang,Ming-Feng Tsai

title: Stock Movement Prediction using Technical and Data
summary: This work utilizes Tesla data with sentiment analysis performed on news titles pertaining to the company as well as technical data on its stock over a three year period in order to predict closing price movement.

title: D EEP M ULTIPLE I NSTANCE L EARNING FOR F ORECASTING S TOCK T RENDS USING F INANCIAL N EWS
summary: This paper develops a flexible and adaptive multi- instance learning model and evaluates its ability in directional movement forecast of Standard & Poor’s 500 index on financial news dataset and demonstrates that the proposed multi-instance-based framework gains outstanding results in terms of the accuracy of trend prediction.

title: M ULTIPLE I NSTANCE L EARNING N ETWORKS FOR S TOCK M OVEMENTS P REDICTION WITH F INANCIAL N EWS
summary: This paper develops a flexible and adaptive multi- instance learning model and evaluates its ability in directional movement forecast of Standard & Poor’s 500 index on financial news dataset and demonstrates that the proposed multi-instance-based framework gains outstanding results in terms of the accuracy of trend prediction.

title: Understanding the Association Between Cryptocurrency Price Predictive Performance and Input Features
summary: The results of the experiment showed that cryptocurrency price predictive performance the best when open price, high price, low price, volume and price were combined except for rate of closing price fluctuation.

title: Guided Attention Multimodal Multitask Financial Forecasting with Inter-Company Relationships and Global and Local News
summary: The proposed Guided Attention Multimodal Multitask Network (GAME) model addresses challenges by using novel attention modules to guide learning with global and local information from different modalities and dynamic inter-company relationship networks.
venue: Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics

title: Threshold-based portfolio: the role of the threshold and its applications
summary: It is found that the risk and return profile of the realized TBP represents a monotonically increasing frontier on the risk–return plane, where the equally weighted universe portfolio plays a role in the lower bound of TBPs.

title: Analysing forward-looking statements in initial public offering prospectuses: a text analytics approach
summary: The study finds that FLS features are more predictive for pre-IPo as compared to post-IPO valuation prediction, and proposes an analytical pipeline for identifying FLSs using machine learning techniques.

title: An interpretable LSTM neural network for autoregressive exogenous model
summary: Variable importance in real datasets characterized by the variable attention is highly in line with that determined by statistical Granger causality test, which exhibits the prospect of multi-variable LSTM as a simple and uniform end-to-end framework for both forecasting and knowledge discovery.

title: A Survey of Deep Learning: Platforms, Applications and Emerging Research Trends
summary: A thorough investigation of deep learning in its applications and mechanisms is sought, as a categorical collection of state of the art in deep learning research, to provide a broad reference for those seeking a primer on deep learning and its various implementations, platforms, algorithms, and uses in a variety of smart-world systems.

title: Multi-variable LSTM neural network for autoregressive exogenous model
summary: This paper proposes a multi-variable LSTM capable of accurate forecasting and variable importance interpretation for time series with exogenous variables and exhibits the prospect of multi- variable L STM as an end-to-end framework for both forecasting and knowledge discovery.

title: Threshold-based portfolio: the role of the threshold and its applications
summary: It is found that the risk and return profile of the realized TBP represents a monotonically increasing frontier on the risk–return plane, where the equally weighted universe portfolio plays a role in the lower bound of TBPs.

title: Temporal Relational Ranking for Stock Prediction
summary: A new deep learning solution, named Relational Stock Ranking (RSR), named Temporal Graph Convolution, which jointly models the temporal evolution and relation network of stocks and outperforms state-of-the-art stock prediction solutions.
authors: Fuli Feng,Xiangnan He,Xiang Wang,Cheng Luo,Yiqun Liu,Tat-Seng Chua

title: Improving Stock Movement Prediction with Adversarial Training
summary: A new machine learning solution for stock movement prediction, which aims to predict whether the price of a stock will be up or down in the near future, is added to simulate the stochasticity of continuous price variable, and train the model to work well under small yet intentional perturbations.
authors: Fuli Feng,Huimin Chen,Xiangnan He,Ji Ding,Maosong Sun,Tat-Seng Chua

title: Hierarchical Complementary Attention Network for Predicting Stock Price Movements with News
summary: A hierarchical complementary attention network (HCAN) is proposed to capture valuable complementary information in news title and content for stock movement prediction and experimental results show that the proposed model outperforms the state-of-the-art techniques.
venue: International Conference on Information and Knowledge Management

title: The Profitablity Graph of Financing Companies in Indonesia
venue: Proceedings of the Proceedings of the 1st International Conference on Finance Economics and Business, ICOFEB 2018, 12-13 November 2018, Lhokseumawe, Aceh, Indonesia
authors: A. Lubis,M. Ismail,Z. Tarigan,Tapi Anda Sari Lubis,I. Muda

title: I Understand What You Are Saying: Leveraging Deep Learning Techniques for Aspect Based Sentiment Analysis
summary: This study investigates aspect based sentiment dynamics of online reviews by proposing a semi-supervised, deep learning facilitated analytical pipeline and presents a novel perspective to understanding the dynamics of aspect based sentiments by analyzing aspects based sentiment in time series.
venue: Hawaii International Conference on System Sciences

title: Sensing Social Media Signals for Cryptocurrency News
summary: This work compares several machine learning models, such as linear extrapolation, linear and random forest autoregressive models, and a sequence-to-sequence neural network for predicting the number of article mentions on Twitter after its publication of cryptocurrency news.
authors: Johannes Beck,Roberta Huang,David Lindner,Tian Guo,C. Zhang,D. Helbing,Nino Antulov-Fantulin

title: Exploring Interpretable LSTM Neural Networks over Multi-Variable Data
summary: The structure of LSTM recurrent neural networks to learn variable-wise hidden states is explored, with the aim to capture different dynamics in multi-variable time series and distinguish the contribution of variables to the prediction.

title: Construction of Financial News Sentiment Indices Using Deep Neural Networks
summary: A deep neural network model that combines CNN, Att-BLSTM and BERT for predicting financial news sentiment polarity is designed and it is shown that the news sentiment exhibits a significant relationship with stock market returns.

title: A new metric for individual stock trend prediction
summary: It is suggested that MPR is a more effective metric than the classification metrics in stock trend prediction, which is measured based on the correlation between the metric value and profit of the model.

title: Deep learning in exchange markets
summary: Although the LSTM is more suitable for multivariate time series analysis from a theoretical point of view, test results indicate that the CNN has on average the best predictive power in the case study under analysis, which is the UK to Win Horse Racing market during pre-live stage in the world’s most relevant betting exchange.
authors: Rui Gonçalves,V. Ribeiro,F. L. Pereira,A. Rocha

title: Optimistic Bull or Pessimistic Bear: Adaptive Deep Reinforcement Learning for Stock Portfolio Allocation
summary: A novel Adaptive Deep Deterministic Reinforcement Learning scheme (Adaptive DDPG) is proposed for the portfolio allocation task, which incorporates optimistic or pessimistic deep reinforcement learning that is reflected in the influence from prediction errors.

title: EAN: Event Attention Network for Stock Price Trend Prediction based on Sentimental Embedding
summary: An event attention network (EAN) is proposed to exploit sentimental event-embedding for stock price trend prediction and shows that this model performs significantly better in terms of short-term stock trend prediction.
authors: Yaowei Wang,Qing Li,J. Huang,Mark Junjie Li

title: LSTM with Wavelet Transform Based Data Preprocessing for Stock Price Prediction
summary: A new multioptimal combination wavelet transform (MOCWT) method with a novel threshold-denoising function is presented to reduce the degree of distortion in signal reconstruction, and experimental results clearly showed that the proposed MOCWT outperforms the traditional methods in the term of prediction accuracy.
authors: Xiaodan Liang,Zhaodi Ge,Liling Sun,Maowei He,Hanning Chen

title: AlphaStock
venue: Proceedings of the 25th ACM SIGKDD International Conference on Knowledge Discovery & Data Mining
authors: Jingyuan Wang,Yang Zhang,K. Tang,Junjie Wu,Zhang Xiong

title: Developing an Risk Signal Detection System Based on Opinion Mining for Financial Decision Support
Weibo vs Wall Street Journal: How are Social & Mass Media Different in the Stock Market?
How does social media sentiment impact mass media sentiment? A study of news in the financial markets
summary: Using data from Sina Weibo and Sina Finance, it is shown that social media does influence mass media sentiment emergence for financial news and the sentiment consistency between social media reaction and prior news articles amplifies the persistence ofmass media sentiment over time.

title: A Deep Learning Framework for Pricing Financial Instruments
summary: An integrated deep learning architecture for the stock movement prediction that simultaneously leverages all available alpha sources and designs a graph-based component that extracts cross-sectional interactions which circumvents usage of SVD that's needed in standard models.
authors: Qiong Wu,Zheng Zhang,A. Pizzoferrato,Mihai Cucuringu,Zhenming Liu

title: Equity2Vec: end-to-end deep learning framework for cross-sectional asset pricing
summary: This work proposes an end-to-end deep learning framework to price assets that simultaneously leverages all the available heterogeneous alpha sources including technical indicators, financial news signals, and cross-sectional signals and monetizes the signals effectively.
venue: International Conference on AI in Finance
authors: Qiong Wu,Christopher G. Brinton,Zhenghao Zhang,A. Pizzoferrato,Zhenming Liu,Mihai Cucuringu

title: Stock closing price prediction based on sentiment analysis and LSTM
summary: It is confirmed that investors’ emotional tendency is effective to improve the predicted results; the introduction of EMD can improve the predictability of inventory sequences; and the attention mechanism can help LSTM to efficiently extract specific information and current mission objectives from the information ocean.

title: Exploring Graph Neural Networks for Stock Market Predictions with Rolling Window Analysis
summary: This paper investigates the effectiveness of work at the intersection of market predictions and graph neural networks, which hold the potential to mimic the ways in which investors make decisions by incorporating company knowledge graphs directly into the predictive model.

title: WATTNet: Learning to Trade FX via Hierarchical Spatio-Temporal Representation of Highly Multivariate Time Series
summary: WaveATTentionNet (WATTNet) is introduced, a novel temporal convolution (TCN) model for spatio-temporal modeling of highly multivariate time series and validated it across NDF markets with varying degrees of dissimilarity between the training and test periods in terms of volatility and general market regimes.
venue: Proceedings of the Twenty-Ninth International Joint Conference on Artificial Intelligence

title: News2vec: News Network Embedding with Subnode Information
summary: The News2vec model is proposed to allow the distributed representation of news taking into account its associated features, and offers an easy solution to create embeddings for unseen news nodes based on its attributes.
venue: Conference on Empirical Methods in Natural Language Processing

title: An integrated early warning system for stock market turbulence
summary: The proposed EWS first classifies stock market crises according to an indicator function with thresholds dynamically selected by the two-peak method, then a hybrid algorithm is developed in the framework of a long short-term memory network to make daily predictions that alert turmoils.

title: Financial Time Series Forecasting with Deep Learning : A Systematic Literature Review: 2005-2019
summary: A comprehensive literature review on DL studies for financial time series forecasting implementations and grouped them based on their DL model choices, such as Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs), Deep Belief Networks (DBNs), Long-Short Term Memory (LSTM).
authors: Omer Berat Sezer,M. U. Gudelek,A. Ozbayoglu

title: Deep Learning for Financial Applications : A Survey
summary: This paper tried to provide a state-of-the-art snapshot of the developed DL models for financial applications, as of today, and categorized the works according to their intended subfield in finance but also analyzed them based on their DL models.
authors: A. Ozbayoglu,M. U. Gudelek,Omer Berat Sezer

title: News Headlines Categorization Scheme for Unlabelled Data
summary: A news categorization scheme is proposed to filter out and categorize news headlines related to Pakistan Stock Exchange (PSX) using negligible manual effort and natural language processing based technique is used to extract context of seed keyword from initially filtered news headlines.
venue: 2020 International Conference on Emerging Trends in Smart Technologies (ICETST)

title: An Adaptive Master-Slave Regularized Model for Unexpected Revenue Prediction Enhanced with Alternative Data
summary: This paper proposed an adaptive master-slave regularized model, called AMS, to effectively leverage alternative data for unexpected revenue prediction and has demonstrated the effectiveness of the model against a set of competitors.
venue: IEEE International Conference on Data Engineering
authors: Jin Xu,Jingbo Zhou,Yongpo Jia,Jian Li,Hui Xiong

title: Incorporating Expert-Based Investment Opinion Signals in Stock Prediction: A Deep Learning Framework
summary: A novel framework which includes a stance detection model named MFN, which learns the representation of each review by integrating multi-view textual features and extended knowledge in financial domain to distill bullish/bearish investment opinions, and can effectively improve the performance of both investment opinion mining and individual stock forecasting.

title: On the predictability of U.S. stock market using machine learning and deep learning techniques
summary: The techniques are proven to be robust both statistically and economically when forecasting the equity premium out-of-sample using recursive window method and overall, the deep learning techniques produced the best result in this thesis.

title: Electronic word-of-mouth effects on studio performance leveraging attention-based model
authors: Yang Liu,Hao Fei,Qingguo Zeng,Bobo Li,Lili Ma,Donghong Ji,Joaquín B. Ordieres Meré

title: Electronic word-of-mouth effects on studio performance leveraging attention-based model
summary: This study proves that deep learning with the attention mechanism has the best accuracy in both eWOM and stock price movement and presents both a hierarchical two-layer attention network and hierarchical convoluted attention network (HCAN), which quantify the importance of crucial eWom features in capturing valuable information from audience members’ reviews.
authors: Yang Liu,Hao Fei,Qingguo Zeng,Bobo Li,Lili Ma,Donghong Ji,Joaquín B. Ordieres Meré

title: Feature Transformation and Simulation of Short Term Price Variability in Reinforcement Learning for Portfolio Management
summary: Two automatic feature transformation techniques - Bayesian recurrent neural network (BRNN) and GANs for modelling short-term realistic price variability are able to improve the performance of reinforcement learning agents in solving portfolio management problem effectively, when measured in terms of increasing profitability and reducing risks.

title: ESG2Risk: A Deep Learning Framework from ESG News to Stock Volatility Prediction
summary: Experimental evaluation of the proposed pipeline of ESG news extraction, news representations, and Bayesian inference of deep learning models demonstrates the superior predicting performance as well as the relation of high volatility prediction to stocks with potential high risk and low return.
authors: Tian Guo,N. Jamet,Valentin Betrix,Louis-Alexandre Piquet,E. Hauptmann

title: A Novel Distributed Representation of News (DRNews) for Stock Market Predictions
summary: The attention mechanism suggests that short-term stock trend and stock market crises both receive influences from daily news with the former demonstrates more critical responses on the information related to the stock market, whilst the latter draws more concerns on the banking sector and economic policies.

title: Research on Stock Prediction Model Based on Deep Learning
summary: The L STM model with Encoder-Decoder mode and a hybridized framework of LSTM with CNN are built to improve the original model and establish a quantitative model with higher prediction accuracy.
authors: Haiying Zhang,Qiaomei Liang,Siheng Li,Rongqi Wang,Qingqiang Wu

title: A hybrid two-stage financial stock forecasting algorithm based on clustering and ensemble learning
summary: A hybrid prediction model, which combines both the k-means clustering and ensemble learning, has been proposed, and the experimental results demonstrate that the hybrid Prediction model obtains the best predicting accuracy of the stock price.

title: Dancing with Trump in the Stock Market
summary: This article has found that the echoing reinforced effect of financial news with Trump’s market-related tweets can influence the market movement and proposes a deep information echoing model to predict the hourly stock market trend, such as the rise and fall of the Dow Jones Industrial Average.
venue: ACM Transactions on Intelligent Systems and Technology

title: Temporally Correlated Task Scheduling for Sequence Learning
summary: A learnable scheduler to sequence learning is introduced, which can adaptively select auxiliary tasks for training depending on the model status and the current training data, and significantly improves the performance of simultaneous machine translation and stock trend forecasting.
authors: Xueqing Wu,Lewen Wang,Yingce Xia,Weiqing Liu,Lijun Wu,Shufang Xie,Tao Qin,Tie-Yan Liu

title: A novel ensemble deep learning model for stock prediction based on stock prices and news
summary: The purpose of this work is to explain the design philosophy and show that ensemble deep learning technologies can truly predict future stock price trends more effectively and can better assist investors in making the right investment decision than other traditional methods.
venue: International Journal of Data Science and Analysis

title: Multistep-Ahead Stock Price Forecasting Based on Secondary Decomposition Technique and Extreme Learning Machine Optimized by the Differential Evolution Algorithm
summary: The empirical results show that the hybrid model proposed in this paper achieves the best prediction performance in all prediction scenarios, which indicates that the modeling idea focusing on the residual term effectively improves the prediction performance of the model.
authors: Zhenpeng Tang,Tingting Zhang,Junchuan Wu,Xiaoxu Du,Kaijie Chen

title: DEEP LEARING APLICADO À NEGOCIAÇÃO DE AÇÕES POR ALGORITMOS: UMA REVISÃO DESCRITIVA DA LITERATURA
authors: Camilo Ilzo Shimabukuro,Napoleão Verardi Galegale,M. Okano,Celi Langhi

title: Stock movement predictive network via incorporative attention mechanisms based on tweet and historical prices
summary: The core innovation is that the incorporative attention combines local and contextual attention mechanisms to clean the contextual embeddings by using local semantics, which effectively reduce the noises in the constructed higher-level representations and enhance the performance.

title: RGBSticks : A New Deep Learning Based Framework for Stock Market Analysis and Prediction
summary: A novel intuitive graphical representation for daily stock prices is presented, which is referred as RGBSticks, a variation of classical candle sticks, which allows the usage of complex deep learning based techniques to produce insightful visualizations for market’s past and future states.

title: Incorporating stock prices and news sentiments for stock market prediction: A case of Hong Kong
summary: This paper builds up a stock prediction system and proposes an approach that represents numerical price data by technical indicators via technical analysis, and represents textual news articles by sentiment vectors via sentiment analysis, which outperforms the baselines in both validation and test sets using two different evaluation metrics.

title: Stock Price Prediction Using BERT and Word2Vec Sentiment Analysis
summary: This paper experiments with machine learning algorithm and twitter sentiment analysis to predict future stock market prices with results that compare Word2vec and BERT and apply those method in predicting future stock price.
venue: International Journal of Emerging Trends in Engineering Research

title: Using Machine Learning and Alternative Data to Predict Movements in Market Risk
summary: It is shown that movements in market implied volatility can indeed be predicted through the help of machine learning techniques, and preliminary evidence of non-linear relationships between features obtained from Wikipedia page traffic and movements inMarket implied volatility is revealed.

title: Analyzing News Sentiments and their Impact on Stock Market Trends using POS and TF-IDF based approach
summary: A new method in interpreting the sentiment of a given news through a fine-grained analysis of syntactic sentence patterns using different Part of Speech (POS) combinations is proposed, which is compatible with current researches stating about existing correlation between financial news and stock prices.
venue: International Conference on Artificial Intelligence in Engineering and Technology

title: Where Does Trust Break Down? A Quantitative Trust Analysis of Deep Neural Networks via Trust Matrix and Conditional Trust Densities
summary: This work introduces the concept of trust matrix, a novel trust quantification strategy that leverages the recently introduced question-answer trust metric by Wong et al. to provide deeper, more detailed insights into where trust breaks down for a given deep neural network given a set of questions.

title: MAEC
venue: Proceedings of the 29th ACM International Conference on Information & Knowledge Management

title: MAEC: A Multimodal Aligned Earnings Conference Call Dataset for Financial Risk Prediction
summary: A new, large-scale multi-modal, text-audio paired, earnings-call dataset named MAEC, based on S&P 1500 companies is introduced, more than six times larger than those currently available to the research community.
venue: International Conference on Information and Knowledge Management

title: Analysis of financial market trend based on autoregressive conditional heteroscedastic model and BP neural network prediction
summary: The research shows that the BP neural network model established by using the lag variable of the Web text sentiment index as the input layer variable is more reliable and can be widely used in the stock market.

title: Event-Driven Learning of Systematic Behaviours in Stock Markets
summary: This work proposes a pipeline that achieves significantly better accuracies and higher simulated annualized returns than state-of-the-art models when being applied to predicting Standard&Poor 500, Dow Jones, Nasdaq indices and 10 individual stocks.

title: VolTAGE: Volatility Forecasting via Text-Audio Fusion with Graph Convolution Networks for Earnings Calls
summary: This work introduces a neural model for stock volatility prediction that accounts for stock interdependence via graph convolutions while fusing verbal, vocal, and financial features in a semi-supervised multi-task risk forecasting formulation.
venue: Conference on Empirical Methods in Natural Language Processing
authors: Ramit Sawhney,Piyush Khanna,Arshiya Aggarwal,Taru Jain,Puneet Mathur,R. Shah

title: Insights into Fairness through Trust: Multi-scale Trust Quantification for Financial Deep Learning
summary: The insights for this proof-of-concept study demonstrate that such a multi-scale trust quantification strategy may be helpful for data scientists and regulators in financial services as part of the verification and certification of financial deep learning solutions to gain insights into fairness and trust of these solutions.

title: Exchange Rate Forecasting Using Ensemble Modeling for Better Policy Implications
summary: The results indicate that the proposed methodology could be an effective technique to forecast better as compared to the component models separately, and the study has crucial economic and academic implications.

title: FLF-LSTM: A novel prediction system using Forex Loss Function
summary: This study shows that a significant enhancement in the prediction of forex price can be achieved by incorporating domain knowledge in the process of training machine learning models.
authors: Salman Ahmed,Saeed-Ul Hassan,Naif R. Aljohani,R. Nawaz

title: Predicting long-term returns of individual stocks with online reviews
summary: A framework for predicting long-term returns of individual stocks is established based exclusively on online reviews, and 6,246 features of 13 categories inferred from more than 18 million product reviews are elaborated to build the prediction model.

title: Stock Price Prediction Incorporating Market Style Clustering
summary: The results demonstrate that the approach incorporating market styles outperforms the baseline, which does not incorporate market styles in terms of accuracy and F1-score.

title: Stock Price Prediction Incorporating Market Style Clustering
summary: The results demonstrate that the approach incorporating market styles outperforms the baseline, which does not incorporate market styles in terms of accuracy and F1-score.

title: A Survey of Forex and Stock Price Prediction Using Deep Learning
summary: The trend of using deep-learning-based methods for financial modeling is rising exponentially, and recent models combining LSTM with other methods, for example, DNN, are widely researched.

title: Classification using Deep Learning based on selection optimizing counseling data
summary: The value of classification accuracy in counseling data generated by the Deep Learning algorithm has increased to 97.37% with a better level of accuracy, and an algorithm optimization feature for the Deep learning algorithm is proposed.
authors: A. E. Budianto,M. Othman,Y. A. Rahim

title: Multimodal News Feed Evaluation System with Deep Reinforcement Learning Approaches
summary: A hierarchical structure of deep learning algorithms is implemented for making an effective complex news evaluation system for multilingual and multimodal data analysis in news feed evaluation.
venue: ACM Trans. Asian Low Resour. Lang. Inf. Process.

title: RETRACTED ARTICLE: Research on pre- and post-fund performance prediction based on improved neural network algorithm
summary: A fund prediction model based on improved neural network is constructed, genetic algorithm is used to adjust the initial weight and threshold of BP neural network, and comprehensively analyzes the parameters involved in neural network.
venue: Journal of Ambient Intelligence and Humanized Computing

title: Forecasting daily stock trend using multi-filter feature selection and deep learning
summary: This study combines features selected by multiple feature selection approaches and using them as input into a deep generative model outperforms state-of-the-art approaches to predict future price movements.
